name: Hydroblast
text:
Choose one —
• Counter target spell if it's red.
• Destroy target permanent if it's red.

editions.flavor:
"Heed the lessons of our time: the forms of water may move the land itself and hold captive the fires within."
—Gustha Ebbasdotter,
Kjeldoran Royal Mage

"Heed the lessons of our time: the forms of water may move the land itself and hold captive the fires within."
—Gustha Ebbasdotter,
Kjeldoran royal mage

"Heed the lessons of our time: the forms of water may move the land itself and hold captive the fires within."
—Gustha Ebbasdotter,
Kjeldoran royal mage
Fire can be savage, but it is fickle. Water is always true, its flow steady and world-shaping.

name: Hydroform
text: Target land becomes a 3/3 Elemental creature with flying until end of turn. It's still a land.

editions.flavor:
"While the sea may be our home, the sky is our destiny."
—Prime Speaker Zegana

name: Hydrolash
text:
Attacking creatures get -2/-0 until end of turn.
Draw a card.

editions.flavor: "I don't need your mage-rings or your mana equations. I call, and the sea answers."—Keyta, rebel hydromancer

name: Hydromorph Guardian
text: {U}, Sacrifice Hydromorph Guardian: Counter target spell that targets one or more creatures you control.

editions.flavor: In front of every strong leader is a pool of loyal bodyguards.

name: Hydromorph Gull
text:
Flying
{U}, Sacrifice Hydromorph Gull: Counter target spell that targets one or more creatures you control.

editions.flavor:
"The only kind of water that should fly through the air is rain."
—Kamahl, pit fighter

name: Hydrosurge
text: Target creature gets -5/-0 until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"Thirsty?"
—Drunvalus, hydromancer

"Thirsty?"
—Drunvalus, hydromancer
With carrion a rarity in the Broken Lands, the hyenas that stalk the deserts hunt in packs.

name: Hyena Umbra
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 and has first strike.
Totem armor (If enchanted creature would be destroyed, instead remove all damage from it and destroy this Aura.)

name: Hymn of Rebirth
text: Put target creature card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control.

editions.flavor:
"There will come soft rains, and spring shall be amongst us, a welcome friend."
—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran Priest

"There will come soft rains, and spring shall be amongst us, a welcome friend."
—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran priest

name: Hymn of the Wilds
text:
(Start the game with this conspiracy face up in the command zone.)
The first creature spell you cast each turn costs {1} less to cast.
You can't cast instant or sorcery spells.

editions.flavor: Many attempt to speak with nature. Selvala speaks less, and nature answers more.

name: Hymn to Tourach
text: Target player discards two cards at random.

editions.flavor: Knowing the hymn's power, the followers of Leitbur carefully guarded their pillaged transciptions.
The priests plead for your anguish and pray for your despair.

"Tourach's power was such that his followers deified him after his death."
—Sarpadian Empires, vol. II

"The eerie, wailing Hymn caused insanity even in hardened warriors."
—Sarpadian Empires, vol. II
Knowing the Hymn's power, the followers of Leitbur carefully guarded their pillaged transcriptions.
Members of the Order often played the Hymn on instruments made from their victims' bones.
The priests plead for your anguish and pray for your despair.
The priests plead for your anguish and pray for your despair.

name: Hypergenesis
text:
Suspend 3—{1}{G}{G} (Rather than cast this card from your hand, pay {1}{G}{G} and exile it with three time counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter. When the last is removed, cast it without paying its mana cost.)
Starting with you, each player may put an artifact, creature, enchantment, or land card from his or her hand onto the battlefield. Repeat this process until no one puts a card onto the battlefield.

name: Hyperion Blacksmith
text: {T}: You may tap or untap target artifact an opponent controls.

editions.flavor: "The smith a mighty man is he/ With large and sinewy hands./ And the muscles of his brawny arms/ Are strong as iron bands." —Henry Wadsworth Longfellow, The Village Blacksmith

text:
Flying, haste

editions.flavor: Zap on. Zap off.

editions.flavor:

—Ludevic, necro-alchemist

text:
Trample
Whenever Hystrodon deals combat damage to a player, you may draw a card.

Deathtouch
{6}{B}{B}: Monstrosity 3. (If this creature isn't monstrous, put three +1/+1 counters on it and it becomes monstrous.)

name: I Bask in Your Silent Awe
text:
(An ongoing scheme remains face up until it's abandoned.)
Each opponent can't cast more than one spell each turn.
At the beginning of your upkeep, if no opponent cast a spell since your last turn ended, abandon this scheme.

name: Ib Halfheart, Goblin Tactician
text:
Whenever another Goblin you control becomes blocked, sacrifice it. If you do, it deals 4 damage to each creature blocking it.
Sacrifice two Mountains: Create two 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens.

editions.flavor: "Everybody but me—CHARGE!"

editions.set: Duel Decks Anthology, Elves vs. Goblins
editions.flavor: "Everybody but me—CHARGE!"
"Everybody but me—CHARGE!"

name: I Call on the Ancient Magics
text: When you set this scheme in motion, each other player searches his or her library for a card, reveals it, and puts it into his or her hand. Then you search your library for two cards and put them into your hand. Each player shuffles his or her library.

name: Icatian Crier
text: {1}{W}, {T}, Discard a card: Create two 1/1 white Citizen creature tokens.

editions.flavor: A thousand years removed from her home, her news of war had lost its context, but not its relevance.

name: Icatian Infantry
text:
{1}: Icatian Infantry gains first strike until end of turn.
{1}: Icatian Infantry gains banding until end of turn. (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)

editions.flavor: The Icatian army easily repelled early surprise attacks by the Orcs on border towns like Montford.
Although they had long been concerned about the Order of the Ebon Hand, the Icatians faced an even greater threat from Goblin and Orcish raiders.

"Valiant Icatia was the last of the Sarpadian empires to fall. Its faithful soldiers defended their cities to the very end."
—Sarpadian Empires, vol. VI

"Never Surrender"
—Motto carved into a fragment of an Icatian wall

name: Icatian Javelineers
text:
Icatian Javelineers enters the battlefield with a javelin counter on it.
{T}, Remove a javelin counter from Icatian Javelineers: Icatian Javelineers deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

name: Icatian Lieutenant
text: {1}{W}: Target Soldier creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: To become an officer, an Icatian soldier had to pass a series of tests. These evaluated not only fighting and leadership skills, but also integrity, honor, and moral strength.
To become an officer, an Icatian Soldier had to pass a series of tests. These evaluated not only fighting and leadership skills, but also integrity, honor, and moral strength.

name: Icatian Moneychanger
text:
Icatian Moneychanger enters the battlefield with three credit counters on it.
When Icatian Moneychanger enters the battlefield, it deals 3 damage to you.
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a credit counter on Icatian Moneychanger.
Sacrifice Icatian Moneychanger: You gain 1 life for each credit counter on Icatian Moneychanger. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.

name: Icatian Phalanx
text: Banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)

editions.flavor: Even after the wall was breached in half a dozen places, the phalanxes fought on, standing solidly against the onrushing raiders. Disciplined and dedicated, they held their ranks to the end, even in the face of tremendous losses.

Even after the wall was breached in half a dozen places, the phalanxes fought on, standing solidly against the onrushing raiders. Disciplined and dedicated, they held their ranks to the end, even in the face of tremendous losses.

name: Icatian Priest
text: {1}{W}{W}: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Grelden knelt and felt the cool, dry hand of the priest on his brow. Hours later, when his wits returned, he was covered in his enemies' blood on the field of victory.

"May you be strong and valiant, to defeat the enemies of the pure."
—"Leitbur's Prayer"

editions.set: Duel Decks Anthology, Divine vs. Demonic
editions.flavor: Grelden knelt and felt the cool, dry hand of the priest on his brow. Hours later, when his wits returned, he was covered in his enemies' blood on the field of victory.

name: Icatian Scout
text: {1}, {T}: Target creature gains first strike until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"Because the orc hordes attacked along the entire border, Scouts were essential to Icatia's defense."
—Sarpadian Empires, vol. VI

"In these, our final days, I offer this. Though we could not save Icatia, we gave our children time to grow, and love, before it fell."
—Ailis Connaut, diary

"Because the Orc hordes attacked along the entire border, Scouts were essential to Icatia's defense."
—Sarpadian Empires, vol. VI

"Scouting is the art of balancing the need to go undiscovered with the need to get all the information you can. It's only by Leitbur's good grace that I'm still alive today."
—Ailis Connaut, Diary

"Of course I'm not a spy The enemy has spies. I am a Scout."
—Ailis Connaut

"Let it be known that Ailis Connaut acted with honor and bravery in the defense of the town of Montford, risking her life to scout the enemy's position . . . ."
—Proclamation granting knighthood

name: Icatian Skirmishers
text:
First strike; banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
Whenever Icatian Skirmishers attacks, all creatures banded with it gain first strike until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Skirmishers engaged raiders before they could reach the towns. Although these units typically suffered huge losses, they never lacked volunteers.

name: Icatian Store
text:
Icatian Store enters the battlefield tapped.
You may choose not to untap Icatian Store during your untap step.
At the beginning of your upkeep, if Icatian Store is tapped, put a storage counter on it.
{T}, Remove any number of storage counters from Icatian Store: Add {W} to your mana pool for each storage counter removed this way.

name: Icatian Town
text: Create four 1/1 white Citizen creature tokens.

editions.flavor: Icatia's once-peaceful towns faced increasing attacks from orcs and goblins as the climate cooled. By the time the empire fell, they were little more than armed camps.

text:
Enchant creature

When enchanted creature becomes the target of a spell or ability, destroy Ice Cage.

name: Ice Cauldron
text:
{X}, {T}: Put a charge counter on Ice Cauldron and exile a nonland card from your hand. You may cast that card for as long as it remains exiled. Note the type and amount of mana spent to pay this activation cost. Activate this ability only if there are no charge counters on Ice Cauldron.
{T}, Remove a charge counter from Ice Cauldron: Add Ice Cauldron's last noted type and amount of mana to your mana pool. Spend this mana only to cast the last card exiled with Ice Cauldron.

name: Ice Cave
text: Whenever a player casts a spell, any other player may pay that spell's mana cost. If a player does, counter the spell. (Mana cost includes color.)

editions.flavor: Even the oppresive cold of the cave could not temper Eladamri's ire.

name: Icefall
text:
Destroy target artifact or land.
Recover {R}{R} (When a creature is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, you may pay {R}{R}. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand. Otherwise, exile this card.)

editions.flavor: As the Thaw met Terisiare, mountains shed their icy skins, crushing homes and hopes alike.

text:
Flying
When Icefall Regent enters the battlefield, tap target creature an opponent controls. That creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step for as long as you control Icefall Regent. 
Spells your opponents cast that target Icefall Regent cost {2} more to cast.

name: Ideas Unbound
text: Draw three cards. Discard three cards at the beginning of the next end step.

editions.flavor: The apprentice stared in puzzlement. "But Master, you finished writing those spells just yesterday. Don't you remember?" The jushi's heart froze.

name: I Delight in Your Convulsions
text: When you set this scheme in motion, each opponent loses 3 life. You gain life equal to the life lost this way.

editions.flavor: "I can't imagine what you're feeling right now, but I'll try my best."

name: Identity Crisis
text: Exile all cards from target player's hand and graveyard.

editions.flavor:
"To join our ranks, one must be pure. To be pure, one must be blessed by etherium. To be blessed, one must forget oneself."
—Ethersworn prayer

name: Identity Thief
text: Whenever Identity Thief attacks, you may exile another target nontoken creature. If you do, Identity Thief becomes a copy of that creature until end of turn. Return the exiled card to the battlefield under its owner's control at the beginning of the next end step.

name: Idle Thoughts
text: {2}: Draw a card if you have no cards in hand.

editions.flavor: Inspiration strikes the uncluttered mind.

name: Idyllic Tutor
text: Search your library for an enchantment card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

editions.flavor:
"If one's life is blessed, solutions to all life's problems will appear at the right moment."
—The Book of Kith and Kin

name: Ignite Disorder
text: Ignite Disorder deals 3 damage divided as you choose among one, two, or three target white and/or blue creatures.

editions.flavor: "Bant is a world imprisoned by polished stone and tyrannical rule. It yearns to strike back against those who restrain it."
The shaman prowled the academy halls, shaking his head at the pomp and babble of the sages inside. He knew just the spell to liven the place up.

name: Illuminate
text:
Kicker {2}{R} and/or {3}{U} (You may pay an additional {2}{R} and/or {3}{U} as you cast this spell.)
Illuminate deals X damage to target creature. If Illuminate was kicked with its {2}{R} kicker, it deals X damage to that creature's controller. If Illuminate was kicked with its {3}{U} kicker, you draw X cards.

name: Illuminated Folio
text: {1}, {T}, Reveal two cards from your hand that share a color: Draw a card.

editions.flavor: Most such relics remain clasped shut for fear of what ominous truths might be carved into the diptych inside.

name: Illuminated Wings
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has flying.
{2}, Sacrifice Illuminated Wings: Draw a card.

editions.flavor: For a moment, Urza thought not of war and destruction, but of the freedom of the skies.

name: Illumination
text: Counter target artifact or enchantment spell. Its controller gains life equal to its converted mana cost.

editions.flavor:
"A brilliant light can either illuminate or blind. How will you know which until you open your eyes?"
—Asmira, Holy Avenger

name: Illusion
text: Target spell or permanent becomes the color of your choice until end of turn.

name: Illusionary Armor
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +4/+4.
When enchanted creature becomes the target of a spell or ability, sacrifice Illusionary Armor.

name: Illusionary Forces
text:
Flying
Cumulative upkeep {U} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)

editions.flavor:
"This school was founded in secret, operates in secret, and exists for the teaching of secrets. Those who would alter reality must first escape it."
—Gerda Äagesdotter,
Archmage of the Unseen

"This school was founded in secret, operates in secret, and exists for the teaching of secrets. Those who would alter reality must first escape it."
—Gerda Äagesdotter,
Archmage of the Unseen

name: Illusionary Informant
text:
Draft Illusionary Informant face up.
During the draft, you may turn Illusionary Informant face down. If you do, look at the next card drafted by a player of your choice.
Flying

name: Illusionary Mask
text: {X}: You may choose a creature card in your hand whose mana cost could be paid by some amount of, or all of, the mana you spent on {X}. If you do, you may cast that card face down as a 2/2 creature spell without paying its mana cost. If the creature that spell becomes as it resolves has not been turned face up and would assign or deal damage, be dealt damage, or become tapped, instead it's turned face up and assigns or deals damage, is dealt damage, or becomes tapped. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.

name: Illusionary Presence
text:
Cumulative upkeep {U} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, choose a land type. Illusionary Presence gains landwalk of the chosen type until end of turn. (It can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a land of that type.)

editions.flavor:
"We could feel the Shaman's power, as surely as we felt the storm."
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

name: Illusionary Servant
text:
Flying
When Illusionary Servant becomes the target of a spell or ability, sacrifice it.

editions.flavor:
"Illusion is a handy but fragile medium. Use it only in a pinch, or against the dim-witted."
—Jace Beleren

name: Illusionary Terrain
text:
Cumulative upkeep {2} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
As Illusionary Terrain enters the battlefield, choose two basic land types.
Basic lands of the first chosen type are the second chosen type.

editions.flavor:
"The drawing of maps is fruitless in the west near the ice walls; the very earth is formless."
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

name: Illusionary Wall
text:
Defender, flying, first strike
Cumulative upkeep {U} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)

editions.flavor:
"Let them see what is not there and feel what does not touch them. When they no longer trust their senses, that is the time to strike."
—Gerda Äagesdotter,
Archmage of the Unseen

"Let them see what is not there and feel what does not touch them. When they no longer trust their senses, that is the time to strike."
—Gerda Äagesdotter,
Archmage of the Unseen

name: Illusionist's Bracers
text:
Whenever an ability of equipped creature is activated, if it isn't a mana ability, copy that ability. You may choose new targets for the copy.
Equip {3}

editions.flavor: It's easy to believe you're a god when you're twice as powerful as everyone else.

name: Illusionist's Gambit
text:
Cast Illusionist's Gambit only during the declare blockers step on an opponent's turn.
Remove all attacking creatures from combat and untap them. After this phase, there is an additional combat phase. Each of those creatures attacks that combat if able. They can't attack you or a planeswalker you control that combat.

name: Illusionist's Stratagem
text:
Exile up to two target creatures you control, then return those cards to the battlefield under their owner's control.
Draw a card.

editions.flavor:
"When everything hangs on a single moment, be sure you choose the right moment."
—Jace Beleren
